node.title: Australia crushes Bangladesh to reignite World Cup hopes
node.alt: Adam throws his hands in the air and cheers with joy.
node.description: Leg-spinner Adam Zampa takes five wickets as Australia decimate Bangladesh and put themselves in the drivers seat to make the semi-finals of the Twenty20 World Cup.Â
node.content:
["Australia has romped to an eight-wicket victory over Bangladesh in the Twenty20 World Cup to get its\u00a0hopes of qualifying for the semi-finals back on track.", "Australia's quicks ripped through the Bangladesh top order before leg-spinner Adam Zampa cleaned up the tail, taking 5-19\u00a0to see Bangladesh all out for 73 off just 15 overs.", "Intent on lifting Australia's net run rate and make the final four, David Warner,\u00a0captain Aaron Finch and a returning Mitchell Marsh\u00a0then went all out after the Bangladesh attack, scoring the runs in 6.2 overs, with Finch making 40 off 20 deliveries.", "The win was a far cry from the recent loss to England and lifted Australia's net run rate back up to 1.031 and the team above South Africa and into second spot in their group, though both sides have six points from four matches played.", "More to come.", "
Scorecard
"]
